etymology.description: semantic 木 (“wood”) + phonetic 且; modern form stylizes the bottom as 旦 (originally written as 査).
etymology.interpretation: Wood marks an association with trees or wooden objects, while 且 supplied the sound, later reshaped graphically as 旦. Early senses referred to hawthorn and a wooden raft, and the meaning broadened to ‘check/examine’ through the idea of scrutinizing or investigating.

parts.english: and; moreover; for the time being

examples.chinese: 我需要查资料(我需要查資料)。
examples.english: I need to look up information.

examples.chinese: 请你查一下这个问题(請你查一下這個問題)。
examples.pinyin: Qǐng nǐ chá yíxià zhège wèntí.

examples.chinese: 警方正在查这起案件(警方正在查這起案件)。
examples.pinyin: Jǐngfāng zhèngzài chá zhè qǐ ànjiàn.
examples.english: The police are investigating this case.
